meanings.sent1: The teacher's stern expression helped solemnify the classroom atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The judge's words solemnify the importance of telling the truth in court.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to look serious and solemnify the situation made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds overhead seemed to solemnify the mood of the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the church bells ringing helped solemnify the wedding ceremony.

meanings.definition: To give a formal or dignified character to
meanings.sent1: The elegant decorations solemnify the grandeur of the ballroom.
meanings.sent2: The president's speech helped solemnify the importance of the event.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt to solemnify his appearance with a top hat and cane was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The old castle ruins solemnify the history of the ancient kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The traditional attire worn by the dancers helped solemnify the cultural performance.

meanings.definition: To observe or celebrate with solemnity
meanings.sent1: The community gathers to solemnify the memory of those who have passed away.
meanings.sent2: They solemnify the annual ceremony with a moment of silence.
meanings.sent3: The children's attempt to solemnify their tea party with fancy hats and serious faces was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The flickering candles solemnify the dark room during the memorial service.
meanings.sent5: The flag-raising ceremony solemnifies the beginning of the national holiday.
